subtasks: Sit in front of the controls of a plow
Adjust the plow blade depth using a lever
Raise and lower the plow when necessary
Monitor the field for uneven soil or obstructions
Start the tractor engine
Guide the tractor along the dirt lane
Shift gears appropriately for turns and straight paths
Control speed based on road conditions
Attach a spray tank to the rear of the tractor
Check fluid levels and connections on the tank
Activate the spray mechanism on the tractor
Move the nozzle arm to direct pesticide application
Monitor the spray pattern and adjust as needed

tasks.task: start the engine, guide the tractor, shift gears, control speed. Starting the engine might be part of getting ready to drive, but once driving is the main task, the subtasks include all aspects of operating it on the road.
equip tractor with attachment. The subtasks there would be attaching the tank to the rear, checking fluid levels and connections. Maybe checking connections as a subtask.
So, putting this into the required format, each MAINTASK followed by its subtasks. Yep, that's it.
